topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 2.0: Bringing Up Single VSD VM Manually

body.p: Use the following steps to launch the virtual machine for the required HPE DCN Virtualized Services Directory (VSD):

ol.li: Log into the lifecycle manager host.

Copy the VSD qcow image, which you should have downloaded in the Prerequisites, to the var/lib/libvirt/images directory.
Note: The vsd.xml is a sample created for internal HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade development quality assurance. For a production environment, refer to the HPE DCN documentation to deploy and configure the VSD in HA mode.
Execute the following commands: virsh define vsd.xml virsh autostart vsd virsh start vsd

Start a console session to the VSD VM from lifecycle manager host using the following command:
virsh console <vsdname> Login creds Login: root Password: Alcateldc Where <vsdname> is the name of your VSD.

Edit /etc/sysconfig/network-scripts/ifcfg-eth0 file to configure the DCM IP as a static IP address.
For exampleBOOTPROTO=”static” IPADDR=10.20.5.21 NETMASK=255.255.255.0 GATEWAY=10.20.5.1
After NTP is properly synchronized,execute the following command to install VSD:/opt/vsd/install.sh xmpp.<domain_name> -ts -y

Start a console session to the VSD VM from lifecycle manager host using the following command: virsh console <vsdname>
Where <vsdname> is the name of your VSD.

Execute the following command to confirm that you can access VSD. service vsd status
You should see the status as shown:
Use a web browser to launch the VSD Architect dashboard using the DCM IP and port 8443. For example: https://10.x.x.x:8443/

Log into the VSD Architect. The following are the default credentials. Default credentials: User Name: csproot Password: csproot Org: csp VSD Server : auto
The main page appears. If you see the No Valid License Found message, you need to apply the VSD license.
To apply the license click the Open Platform Configuration tab on the top right corner of the dashboard.
Click the Settings tab.
Click the license icon in the left panel.
Copy and paste the license that you have received.

p.b: Create an OSAdmin user and plug-in user

ol.li: Use a web browser to launch the VSD Architect dashboard using the DCM IP and port 8443. For example: https://10.x.x.x:8443/
Log into the VSD Architect. The following are the default credentials. Default credentials: User Name: csproot Password: csproot Org: csp VSD Server : auto
Click the Open Platform Configuration tab on the top right corner of the dashboard.
Click the Settings tab.
Click the User icon on the left panel.
Right-click the csproot user and click Add.
To create a user for the plug-in, click the Open VSP Configuration tab on the top right corner of the dashboard.
Click the CSP Users tab and click +.
Create a user named OSadmin with the password OSadmin. The name and password are case-sensitive.
Click Create.
Click the Groups icon to add the user to the CMS Group.
Select the CMS Group, then click OSadmin to add the user.
